meanings.definition: To argue or dispute angrily or vehemently.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, they were altercating about the project deadline.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were altercating over who should do the dishes.
meanings.sent3: The altercating neighbors could be heard all the way down the street.
meanings.sent4: The altercating politicians made no progress in reaching a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The altercating couple finally decided to seek counseling for their constant arguments.

meanings.sent1: The altercating between the two friends was getting out of hand.
meanings.sent2: The altercating at the town hall meeting was disruptive.
meanings.sent3: The altercating over the last piece of cake was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The altercating in the courtroom was like a scene from a movie.
meanings.sent5: The altercating between the rival teams added excitement to the game.
